00022 /* Protocol structure
00023  * ------------------
00024  * --------------------------------------------
00025  * |0xFE|0xFE|CMD|LENGTH|DATA[0]..DATA[n]|0xFD|
00026  * --------------------------------------------
00027  * After each message an ACK should be sent back to the computer. If no other data
00028  * is returned then just an ACK message containing the checksum, otherwise data that
00029  * should be sent back with the checksum retrieved as the DATA[0].
00030  */
00031 
00032 //Debug flag for the computer communication protocol
00033 //#define COM_DEBUG
00034 #include <stdio.h>
00035 #include <stdlib.h>
00036 #include <avr/io.h>
00037 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
00038 #include <avr/eeprom.h>
00039 #include <string.h>
00040 #include <avr/wdt.h>
00041 
00042 #include "computer_interface.h"
00043 #include "usart.h"
00044 #include "main.h"
00045 
00046 #include "../internal_comm.h"
00047 #include "../internal_comm_commands.h"
00048 
00050 #define COMPUTER_RX_BUFFER_LENGTH       128
00051 
00053 #define COMPUTER_TX_BUFFER_LENGTH       20
00054 
00056 #define COMPUTER_INTERFACE_FIXED_SIZE   5
00057 
00059 #define COMPUTER_COMM_PREAMBLE  0xFE
00061 #define COMPUTER_COMM_POSTAMBLE 0xFD
00063 #define COMPUTER_COMM_ACK                               0xFA
00065 #define COMPUTER_COMM_NACK                      0xFB
00066 
00068 #define COMPUTER_COMM_REDIRECT_DATA                                     0x10
00069 
00071 #define COMPUTER_COMM_FLAG_FOUND_PREAMBLE       1
00073 #define COMPUTER_COMM_FLAG_DATA_IN_RX_BUF       2
00074 
00076 typedef struct {
00078         char *tx_buffer;
00080         char *tx_buffer_start;
00082         unsigned int tx_buffer_length;
00084         char *rx_buffer;
00086         char *rx_buffer_start;
00088         unsigned char data_in_tx_buffer;
00090         unsigned char flags;
00092         unsigned char command;
00094         unsigned char length;
00096         unsigned int count;
00097 } computer_comm_struct;
00098 
00100 computer_comm_struct computer_comm;
00101 
00103 void (*bootloader_start)(void) = (void *)0x1FE00;
00104 
00106 void computer_interface_init(void) {
00107         // Setup the RX buffer
00108         computer_comm.rx_buffer = (char *)malloc(COMPUTER_RX_BUFFER_LENGTH);
00109         computer_comm.rx_buffer_start = computer_comm.rx_buffer;
00110         
00111         computer_comm.tx_buffer = (char *)malloc(COMPUTER_TX_BUFFER_LENGTH);
00112         computer_comm.tx_buffer_start = computer_comm.tx_buffer;
00113         
00114         computer_comm.data_in_tx_buffer = 0;
00115 }
00116 
00118 void computer_interface_send_data(void) {
00119         if (computer_comm.data_in_tx_buffer == 1) {
00120                 for (int i=0;i<computer_comm.tx_buffer_length;i++)
00121                         usart1_transmit(computer_comm.tx_buffer_start[i]);
00122                 
00123                 computer_comm.tx_buffer = computer_comm.tx_buffer_start;
00124                 computer_comm.tx_buffer_length = 0;
00125 
00126                 computer_comm.data_in_tx_buffer = 0;
00127         }
00128 }
00129 
00134 void computer_interface_send(unsigned char command, unsigned int length, char *data) {
00135         computer_comm.tx_buffer[0] = COMPUTER_COMM_PREAMBLE;
00136         computer_comm.tx_buffer[1] = COMPUTER_COMM_PREAMBLE;
00137         computer_comm.tx_buffer[2] = command;
00138         computer_comm.tx_buffer[3] = length;
00139         int i;
00140         for (i=0;i<length;i++)
00141                 computer_comm.tx_buffer[4+i] = data[i];
00142                 
00143         computer_comm.tx_buffer[4+i] = COMPUTER_COMM_POSTAMBLE;
00144         
00145         computer_comm.tx_buffer_length = COMPUTER_INTERFACE_FIXED_SIZE+length;
00146                         
00147         computer_comm.data_in_tx_buffer = 1;
00148 }
00149 
00151 void computer_interface_send_ack(void) {
00152         computer_comm.tx_buffer[0] = COMPUTER_COMM_PREAMBLE;
00153         computer_comm.tx_buffer[1] = COMPUTER_COMM_PREAMBLE;
00154         computer_comm.tx_buffer[2] = COMPUTER_COMM_ACK;
00155         computer_comm.tx_buffer[3] = 0x00;
00156         computer_comm.tx_buffer[4] = COMPUTER_COMM_POSTAMBLE;
00157         
00158         computer_comm.tx_buffer_length = 5;
00159         computer_comm.data_in_tx_buffer = 1;
00160 }
00161 
00163 void computer_interface_send_nack(void) {
00164         computer_comm.tx_buffer[0] = COMPUTER_COMM_PREAMBLE;
00165         computer_comm.tx_buffer[1] = COMPUTER_COMM_PREAMBLE;
00166         computer_comm.tx_buffer[2] = COMPUTER_COMM_NACK;
00167         computer_comm.tx_buffer[3] = 0x00;
00168         computer_comm.tx_buffer[4] = COMPUTER_COMM_POSTAMBLE;
00169 
00170         computer_comm.tx_buffer_length = 5;
00171         computer_comm.data_in_tx_buffer = 1;
00172 }
00173 
00175 void computer_interface_parse_data(void) {
00176         if (computer_comm.flags & (1<<COMPUTER_COMM_FLAG_DATA_IN_RX_BUF)) {
00177                 
00178                 if (computer_comm.command == INT_COMM_REDIRECT_DATA) {
00179                         internal_comm_add_tx_message(INT_COMM_PC_CTRL, computer_comm.length, (void *)computer_comm.rx_buffer_start);
00180                         
00181                         computer_interface_send_ack();
00182                 }
00183                 else
00184                         computer_interface_send_nack();
00185                 
00186                 //Clear the RX flag
00187                 computer_comm.flags &= ~(1<<COMPUTER_COMM_FLAG_DATA_IN_RX_BUF);
00188                 computer_comm.rx_buffer = computer_comm.rx_buffer_start;
00189         }
00190 }
00191 
00192 ISR(SIG_USART1_DATA) {
00193         
00194 }
00195 
00197 ISR(SIG_USART1_RECV) {
00198         unsigned char data = UDR1;
00199         
00200         //Has a preamble been found?
00201         if (computer_comm.flags & (1<<COMPUTER_COMM_FLAG_FOUND_PREAMBLE)) {
00202                 //Check if the data is a postamble
00203                 if ((data == COMPUTER_COMM_POSTAMBLE) && ((computer_comm.count-2) == computer_comm.length)) {
00204                         computer_comm.rx_buffer = computer_comm.rx_buffer_start;
00205                         
00206                         computer_comm.flags |= (1<<COMPUTER_COMM_FLAG_DATA_IN_RX_BUF);
00207                         computer_comm.flags &= ~(1<<COMPUTER_COMM_FLAG_FOUND_PREAMBLE);
00208                 }
00209                 else {
00210                         switch(computer_comm.count) {
00211                                 case 0: 
00212                                         computer_comm.command = data;
00213                                         break;
00214                                 case 1: 
00215                                         computer_comm.length += data;
00216                                         break;
00217                                 default:
00218                                         *(computer_comm.rx_buffer++) = data;
00219                                         break;
00220                         }
00221 
00222                         computer_comm.count++;
00223                 }
00224         }
00225         else if ((computer_comm.rx_buffer - computer_comm.rx_buffer_start > 0) && (data == COMPUTER_COMM_PREAMBLE)
00226                                                         && (*(computer_comm.rx_buffer-1) == COMPUTER_COMM_PREAMBLE)) {
00227                 computer_comm.rx_buffer = computer_comm.rx_buffer_start;
00228                 computer_comm.flags &= ~(1<<COMPUTER_COMM_FLAG_DATA_IN_RX_BUF);
00229                 computer_comm.flags |= (1<<COMPUTER_COMM_FLAG_FOUND_PREAMBLE);
00230                 
00231                 computer_comm.count = 0;
00232                 computer_comm.length = 0;
00233         }
00234         else {
00235                 if ((computer_comm.rx_buffer - computer_comm.rx_buffer_start) >= COMPUTER_RX_BUFFER_LENGTH) {
00236                         computer_comm.rx_buffer = computer_comm.rx_buffer_start;
00237                 }
00238                 else {
00239                         *(computer_comm.rx_buffer++) = data;
00240                 }
00241         }
00242         
00243 //      usart3_transmit(data);
00244 }
